name: How Places Got Their Names Quiz | Names, Maps and Borders | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Virginia' was named for 'The Virgin Queen'. What was her actual name?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth.

	The colony of Virginia (now the state Commonwealth of Virginia) was named after Queen Elizabeth I by Sir Walter Raleigh.

questions.text: 'Boonesborough' was named for Daniel Boone. Where is it located?
Where does the name 'Seattle' come from?
questions.explanation:
An Indian Leader.

	Chief Seattle of the Duwamish tribe.

questions.text: William "Buffalo Bill" Cody is a legendary figure of the Old West. Where is the city of Cody located?
questions.explanation:
Wyoming.

	It was founded by William Cody in 1895.

questions.text: Lake Champlain is named after Samuel de Champlain, the explorer. In which decade did he explore this lake?
questions.explanation:
1600s.

	He was the first European to sight Lake Champlain in 1609. It is located between the U.S. states of NY and Vermont.

questions.text: Jonestown was named after Jim Jones. Where was it located?
Mr. and Mrs. Bronck gave their name to an area of what city?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	People would go to visit 'the Broncks'. Hence, 'the Bronx'.

questions.text: Lake Louise is a scenic part of Canada. It is named for a daughter of what monarch?
Many bodies of water in New York are named after the explorer Henry Hudson. What happened to him?
questions.correct: He was cast adrift after a mutiny
options: He committed suicide when he failed to find the Northwest Passage
He died aboard ship during an epidemic
He was killed in a battle with Indians
questions.explanation:
He was cast adrift after a mutiny.

	He died in 1611.

questions.text: Which U.S. state has a city that is named in honor of the British statesman, William Pitt?
questions.explanation:
Pennsylvania.

	Pittsburgh (as William Penn is 'Pennsylvania') is located in Pennsylvania.
